title: Artisanal Smoked Salmon and Tangy Lentil Salad
description: A unique and delicious combination featuring artisanally smoked salmon with a tender texture and light smoky aroma, paired with tangy lentils that add freshness and a crunchy texture. This refreshing salad is perfect for a complete meal, highlighting the simplicity and quality of ingredients.
author: Foodette

instructions.instruction: Pour the lentils in a glass to measure their volume. Transfer them to a pot with 3 times their volume of water. Add half of the pink peppercorns (save the rest for later), vegetable bouillon powder, salt, and pepper. Stir, bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce heat and cook covered (with lid or aluminum foil) for 20-25 minutes.
While the lentils are cooking, mix whole grain mustard with wine vinegar in a salad bowl. Add olive oil, lemon juice (1/4 lemon for 2 servings), salt, and pepper. Stir well.
instructions.note: For maximum lemon juice, roll the lemon on your work surface while pressing down with your palm and pierce the flesh with a fork before cutting

instructions.instruction: Rinse the onions and dill under water, dry them and finely chop. Cut the salmon into small pieces. Add everything to the salad bowl.

Once lentils are cooked (taste to check, if not done continue cooking for a few more minutes), quickly rinse under cold water to make them lukewarm. Drain using a colander, add to the salad bowl and mix well.

Taste and adjust seasoning with oil and lemon juice if needed. Enjoy this salad warm (or cold depending on the weather!) sprinkled with the remaining pink peppercorns, either whole or roughly crushed.
